results.content: This is exactly the kind of control I've been looking to acquire. So far, looks great!
results.content_html: This is exactly the kind of control I've been looking to acquire. So far, looks great!

results.content: There are some things that strike as markedly different from how the courses I have taken before as well as lessons I learnt from my work space. The use of all-caps for example in some places and also the use of tables, td and tr when the current trend and possibly future is more about divs and flexboxes. Just wondering if this will be useful in new projects where customers are more web-savvy and know a little bit about how pages are designed. Undoubtedly there are some interesting features, but I think the course would be more bang-on if it used, say, bootstrap and jquery or material or any of the other UI frameworks that are preferred.

results.content: Excellent tool for your web development tool box!  Forms are a significant part of web development.  This course has some excellent template validations for every form input, which enables a developer to enhance user experience in filling out forms.
results.content_html: Excellent tool for your web development tool box! Forms are a significant part of web development. This course has some excellent template validations for every form input, which enables a developer to enhance user experience in filling out forms.

results.content: It saved me so much time. I started learning HTML with v.4 in the early 2000s and it was on and off for a long time so it took me longer than most to gain any level of competency with the mark-up language. Then around 2013 or 2014, I gave it up for good, with cms becoming more competent I made the mistake of assuming HTML was a waste of time. Fast forward to the present day and I realized how bad of a decision that really was. I'm in a field that has nothing to do with web development but I found a need. So I did what any other sane person would do, I went back and started learning HTML again during my spare time. Luckily, I found this course, which has all information I need for a current project, and since I'm already behind on work in general, this course and its resources are a lifesaver. Craig, you are the man sir!

response.content:
Thanks Duy!

This really motivates me and inspires me. I am a developer and so know the need for quick, ready made resources.

I recently re-recorded the course based on feedback and am really happy that you found the course valueable.

Craig

results.content: I first got this course because it had form validations that I could simply copy and thought that finding out how they are put together would be helpful. I was pleasantly surprised exactly how much information there was on them and the instructor puts it in a easily understood way. Great course if you would like a real understanding of form validations and some code (that you will actually understand by the end of the course) that saves you time and that can be copied to your next project.
